comments: This was an incredibly easy class. Attendance grades didn\'t matter as long as you printed the PPT notes, studied them, and did well on the tests. The man calling himself an anthropologist is a laugh, though. Mission trips do not equal studying a culture, you are Converting them.

He was arrogant, and showed no open-mindedness. It was obvious after 20 min of class what his personal beliefs are, and they heavily tinted the way class was taught. If you did not agree with him, you were simply Wrong. He did not teach what may be, he taught what He believed, and darn all else pretty much. I did NOT like this class, but made an A
BEST PROF. EVER! He does have a ton of degrees & thats why he teaches us. nice to have a prof. that actually knows & cares about what he teaches.

Comes off as arrogant but is really the best. Class is easy to pass as long as you attend class to get attendance points. If you print off ppt and take notes its a much easier class. Gives EVERY single question day before test. There are 5 500 word papers to write that are super easy. Overall a good teacher that has good tastes in 3 piece suits.
As long as you are there everyday you will be ok. He does come off arrogant, but he is great! You earn points jsut for being there every class. I would highly recommend his class.
Taught history of new testament, was fairly likable guy, he could come across as arrogant at times. If you are there for lectures you should do okay, he does power point and textbook.

History of New Testament, I made an A but he was arrogant and if you did not agree with him he did not like it. He basically said his degrees made him right. He had some run ins with students because he was not willing to listen to their opinion.
Best teacher I ever had, learn lots and has very good power points and reviews
